educations.schoolName: University of Baltimore School of Law

headline: Assistant Chief Counsel at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)
summary:
Admitted to Practice Law in Maryland (2012) and the District of Columbia (2014)
Member of the Maryland State Bar Association, Bar Association of Baltimore City, and Baltimore County Bar Association

defaultPosition.description: Represent the Government in removal and asylum proceedings.
defaultPosition.title: Assistant Chief Counsel

positions.description: Represent the Government in removal and asylum proceedings.
positions.title: Assistant Chief Counsel

positions.description: Direct the legislative and advocacy efforts of Marylandâs multi-family rental housing industry.  Represent the industry in state and local government. Shape policy from an industry perspective.  Monitor, review, and research proposed bills, ordinances, and regulations. Prepare and present testimony for state and local legislative bodies. Draft legislation and amendments thereto. Lobby state and local legislators. Maintain relationships with state and local legislators and their staffs.  Coordinate strategies with outside lobbyists and other aligned real estate groups.  Work with opponents to develop compromise legislation and resolve issues. Develop strategies to maximize influence in legislative bodies. Provide guidance to the MMHA PAC Board of Trustees.  Coordinate the activities of the Legislative Committee. Provide legal guidance to association members in complying with laws and regulations. Resolve issues between state and local government and the regulated community.
positions.title: Director of Government Affairs

positions.companyName: The Circuit Court for Baltimore City
positions.description: Drafted orders and judicial opinions. Performed legal research and drafted memoranda relating to criminal matters. Assisted the judge in scheduling cases for Reception Court and trying criminal cases. Supervised the work of interns. Provided additional support as required.
positions.title: Judicial Law Clerk

positions.description: Represented the Government in removal and asylum proceedings under the supervision of an ICE attorney, including addressing pre-trial issues, making opening and closing statements, and cross examining witnesses. Drafted appeals to the Board of Immigration Appeals. Drafted briefs, motions, and written closing arguments for submission to the Immigration Judge. Researched legal issues relating to immigration and administrative law.
positions.title: Law Clerk

positions.description: Coordinated and executed 7News at 11 a.m., the highest-rated program in the time slot. Wrote and reported news stories. Determined story placement and resource allocation. Cultivated story ideas and produced special projects, including in-depth series and primetime specials. Developed unique content for www.thedenverchannel.com.
positions.title: News Producer

positions.description: Successfully supervised a staff of three producers, two editors, and a live news crew in the production of a two-hour morning newscast, 21 News This Morning. Developed and launched new format for 21 News This Morning. Earned two Emmy Nominations (2003, 2004) for Best Morning Newscast, NATAS Mid-Atlantic Region. Learned state-of-the-art newsroom software and trained fellow employees. Performed duties similar to those listed above.
positions.title: Senior News Producer

positions.description: Investigated story ideas, conducted interviews, and researched public records for Crime & Justice investigations. Obtained information about breaking news stories and dispatched crews as necessary.
positions.title: Investigative Producer, Assignment Editor
